description: Redux is the implementation of the Flux pattern which is best know as a proposal by Facebook for organizing complex web applications. However, getting started with Redux in the context of building complex applications can be a little intimidating. In this series, Redux architecture will be treated from the ground up, starting with a simple Node application that demonstrates the use of a single reducer, a simple store, and a basic set of operations using the store. As the series progresses, we will explore the use of action creators, code organization patterns in the context of Redux, as well as how to manage increasing complex state objects. If you want to understand Redux without the complication of React or other additions, then tune in! Hope to see you there.

name: Intro to Redux
subtitle: Scalable state management

episodes.description: Redux is the implementation of the Flux pattern which is best know as a proposal by Facebook for organizing complex web applications. However, getting started with Redux in the context of building complex applications can be a little intimidating. In this series, Redux architecture will be treated from the ground up, starting with a simple Node application that demonstrates the use of a single reducer, a simple store, and a basic set of operations using the store. episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and John explore the JavaScript library Redux. John describes and discusses the problems that Redux solves in the context of an application as well as gets our development environment up and running. Lastly, John walks us through our first Redux based example and highlights the parts that are required.
episodes.title: Why Redux

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and John dive into increasingly complex state objects that can crop up when using Redux. John shows the reason to ensure that the Redux reducers are pure and demonstrates how things can go awry if we violate the purity of reducers.
episodes.title: Principles

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and John jump back into exploring Redux specifically taking a look at lists. John explores the structure of a list, how to structure the operations for lists in the context of Redux, and highlights a gotcha when managing complex states.
episodes.title: Lists are Different

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and John jump back into exploring Redux specifically taking a look at lists. John explores the structure of a list, how to structure the operations for lists in the context of Redux, and highlights a gotcha when managing complex states.
episodes.title: Wrapping Up
